Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with a dramatic slave mask. There is a short nozzle (damaged) and a narrow nozzle-channel. On the rear shoulder is a small pierced handle (broken); on each side are unpierced lugs. Within the base-ring is the name PHOETASPI in relief; above is an impressed monogram including the letters pi and omicron. Covered with a dark red slip on top, and partly down the underbody.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1962.bis)
